name: Spicy Chipotle Sweet Potato Soup
description: Can be mildly spicy to REALLY spicy depending on your taste. The chipotle gives the soup a really nice smoky taste. Use two cans of chipotle peppers for extra spice.
recipeIngredient: 3 ½ pounds sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into 2-inch chunks
4 ½ cups vegetable broth, or as needed
1 (7 ounce) can chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, drained
½ cup chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Heat olive oil in a large saucepan or Dutch oven over medium heat; cook and stir onion in the hot oil until softened, 3 to 5 minutes. Add sweet potatoes and enough vegetable broth to cover sweet potatoes; bring to a boil. Reduce heat, partially cover saucepan, and simmer until sweet potatoes are tender enough to easily pierce with a fork, about 30 minutes.
Stir chipotle peppers into the sweet potato mixture.
Blend sweet potato mixture with an immersion blender until soup is smooth. Whisk heavy cream and lime juice into soup until smooth and heated through; season with salt.
Serve each portion of soup topped with 2 tablespoons sour cream and a sprinkle of cilantro.

review.reviewBody: Very good although I used 2 cans of chipotle peppers and it was almost too spicy (and I love spicy).
An amazing combination and pleasing to all palates.

Who knew one tiny can could pack so much punch!! This is spicy!! And I only did one can of chipotle peppers but it is good! Clearing up my sinuses also I added about a tablespoon of garlic to the onion! And my sweet potatoes were white on the inside!

Spicy Chipotle Sweet Potato Soup by Kent Jacobs.  Subbed corn for sweets.  I halved ... Sauteed 3/4c onion then added 1T dried cilantro & 2T chipotle puree (one more would've been fine, I think). I stirred that around to bring out the flavors by heating. Added 3c homemade chicken broth. Brought to a boil then added 1/2# frozen corn. Brought to a boil again & simmered 15; added 1/4c heavy cream & 1t lime juice. I had a cup of (canned) diced tomatoes hanging around so added them then; good addition. A li'l 411, homemade chicken stock will separate when it's cold so don't whack when it layers into corn, stock & the dreamy-ish top layers. It reheats fine. This is a nice warm-up soup - not snowing type, but cold & breezy. :) A red or pinto, maybe black, bean wouldn't hurt things. :D ... Note4Me: Spicy Chipotle Corn Chowder.

3 3 17 ... http://allrecipes.com/recipe/230369/spicy-chipotle-sweet-potato-soup/ ... I'm a nice person.  I just don't do nice things.  Kidding, kinda.  Changes!  ... I'm good with some sweet & spicy combinations, but sweet potatoes & spicy don't grab me.  That's change number one:  subbed with corn.  (Yeah, I did change it majorly with that; but I'm pleased with the results sooooo ... forgiven?!?) Okay, okayyyy, I'll stop yakkin' & start my review!  Again, I halved ... Sauteed 3/4c onion then added 1T dried cilantro & 2T chipotle puree (one more would've been fine, I think).  I stirred that around to bring out the flavors by heating.  Added 3c homemade chicken broth.  Brought to a boil then added 1/2# frozen corn.  Brought to a boil again & simmered 15; added 1/4c heavy cream & 1t lime juice.  I had a cup of (canned) diced tomatoes hanging around so added them then;  good addition.  A li'l 411, homemade chicken stock will separate when it's cold so don't whack when it layers into corn, stock & the dreamy-ish top layers.  It reheats fine.  This is a nice warm-up soup - not snowing type, but cold & breezy.  :)  A red or pinto, maybe black, bean wouldn't hurt things.  :D  ... Note4Me: Spicy Chipotle Corn Chowder.
Even my foodie friends agree this is great soup with just the right amount of heat.
